choices.answer: Tax, make war and establish peace
Prosecute criminals, send and receive ambassadors, and select Congressmen

questions.question: Which of the following problems did Congress experience under the Articles of Confederation?

choices.answer: Congress could not raise a military to defend itself at Yorktown.
Could not tax the states and therefore had difficulty in repaying its debts
Congress could not convince Thomas Jefferson to be a diplomat to France

choices.answer: force citizens to join the army

questions.question: Under the Articles, Congress could do which of the following?

choices.answer: Issue a tax on imported goods
Pass laws and require states to obey them
Amend the articles without consulting the states
Declare war on a foreign nation

questions.question: The authors of the Articles of Confederation established a weak central government mainly to

choices.answer: to cancel state debts incurred during the Revolutionary War
assist the southern states in their efforts to gain a manufacturing base
prevent the abuses of power that had existed under British rule
promote the common goal of national sovereignty

questions.question: Which governmental problem occurred under the Articles of Confederation?

choices.answer: Congress constantly overrode the President's vetoes
The states frequently did not cooperate with each other.
The Supreme Court issued a series of unenforceable decisions.
The President often ignored the advice of his Cabinet

questions.question: The main weakness of the government under the Articles of Confederation was that the government

choices.answer: gave the larger states more power than smaller states
had no authority to borrow or coin money
did not have enough power to rule effectively
depended too heavily on the military for support

questions.question: In which way could the Articles of Confederation be considered a success?

choices.answer: It provided a system for admitting new states in the North West territory.
It created an open market that fostered interstate trade.
It set the nation on a sound financial base
It established a strong, widely respected foreign policy

questions.question: The Northwest Ordinance of 1787 was important because it

choices.answer: ensured universal suffrage for all males
provided a process for admission of new states to the Union
extended slavery north of the Ohio River
established reservations for Native American Indians

questions.question: What was a primary reason for holding the Constitutional Convention of 1787?

choices.answer: outlaw slavery in both the North and South
place taxes on imports and exports
reduce the power of the federal government

questions.question: A compromise reached at the Constitutional Convention of 1787 was that

choices.answer: states were given the power to make treaties
slavery was prohibited throughout the United States
an individual could serve only two terms as President

questions.question: The "Three-fifths Compromise" and the "Great Compromise" dealt with the issue of

choices.answer: establishment of a written form of government
strengthening of the power of the central/federal government
